speaker: Emma
text: The client said they want the platform to support real-time notifications. Do you think we can integrate that without rewriting the whole backend?
ipa: ðə ˈklaɪənt sɛd ðeɪ wɑnt ðə ˈplætˌfɔrm tə səˈpɔrt ˈriəl taɪm ˌnoʊtəfɪˈkeɪʃənz | dʊ jə θɪŋk wi kən ˈɪntəˌɡreɪt ðæt wɪˈðaʊt ˈriˌraɪtɪŋ ðə hoʊl ˈbækˌɛnd
stress: The CLIENT SAID they WANT the PLATFORM to SUPPORT REAL-TIME NOTIFICATIONS | do YOU THINK we can INTEGRATE that WITHOUT REWRITING the WHOLE BACKEND
linking:
"do you" → /dʊ jə/ (link 'do' to 'you')
"can integrate" → /kən ˈɪntəˌɡreɪt/ (link 'can' to 'integrate')
"without rewriting" → /wɪˈðaʊt ˈriˌraɪtɪŋ/ (connected phrase)

speaker: Noah
text: Hmm... we could try using WebSockets. It might save us a lot of time compared to polling.
ipa: hmm | wi kʊd traɪ ˈjuzɪŋ ˈwɛbˌsɑkɪts | ɪt maɪt seɪv ʌs ə lɑt əv taɪm kəmˈpɛrd tə ˈpɑlɪŋ
stress: Hmm... we COULD TRY USING WEBSOCKETS | it MIGHT SAVE US a LOT of TIME compared to POLLING
linking:
"could try" → /kʊd traɪ/ (link 'could' to 'try')
"save us" → /seɪv ʌs/ (link 'save' to 'us')

speaker: Emma
text: Yeah, WebSockets are able to handle real-time communication efficiently. But do you think our server can manage that load?
ipa: jæ | ˈwɛbˌsɑkɪts ɑr ˈeɪbəl tə ˈhændəl ˈriəl taɪm kəˌmjunəˈkeɪʃən ɪˈfɪʃəntli | bət dʊ jə θɪŋk ɑr ˈsɜrvɚ kən ˈmænɪʤ ðæt loʊd
stress: Yeah | WEBSOCKETS are ABLE to HANDLE REAL-TIME COMMUNICATION EFFICIENTLY | but DO YOU THINK our SERVER can MANAGE that LOAD
linking:
"are able to" → /ɑr ˈeɪbəl tə/ (smooth linking)
"do you" → /dʊ jə/ (common reduction)
"can manage" → /kən ˈmænɪʤ/ (link 'can' to 'manage')

speaker: Noah
text: It might struggle at first. We could always start with a small-scale version and then optimize once we know how many users will be active.
ipa: ɪt maɪt ˈstrʌɡəl ət fɜrst | wi kʊd ˈɔlweɪz stɑrt wɪð ə smɔl skeɪl ˈvɜrʒən ənd ðɛn ˈɑptəˌmaɪz wʌns wi noʊ haʊ ˈmɛni ˈjuzɚz wɪl bi ˈæktɪv
stress: IT MIGHT STRUGGLE at FIRST | we COULD ALWAYS START with a SMALL-SCALE VERSION and THEN OPTIMIZE once we KNOW how MANY USERS will be ACTIVE
linking:
"could always" → /kʊd ˈɔlweɪz/ (linking)
"start with" → /stɑrt wɪð/ (link 'start' to 'with')
"once we know" → /wʌns wi noʊ/ (smooth transition)

speaker: Emma
text: That's smart. Alternatively, if WebSockets become too complex, we could implement push notifications via a third-party service like Firebase.
ipa: ðæts smɑrt | ɔlˈtɜrnətɪvli | ɪf ˈwɛbˌsɑkɪts bɪˈkʌm tu kəmˈplɛks | wi kʊd ˈɪmpləˌmɛnt pʊʃ ˌnoʊtəfɪˈkeɪʃənz ˈvaɪə ə θɜrd ˈpɑrti ˈsɜrvɪs laɪk ˈfaɪɚˌbeɪs
stress: That's SMART | Alternatively, if WEBSOCKETS become TOO COMPLEX | we COULD IMPLEMENT PUSH NOTIFICATIONS via a THIRD-PARTY SERVICE like FIREBASE
linking:
"could implement" → /kʊd ˈɪmpləˌmɛnt/ (link 'could' to 'implement')
"service like" → /ˈsɜrvɪs laɪk/ (smooth link)

speaker: Noah
text: Good call. It's important to remember that there are alternatives to building everything from scratch. Sometimes it's better to be able to deliver fast using existing services.
ipa: ɡʊd kɔl | ɪts ɪmˈpɔrtənt tə rɪˈmɛmbɚ ðæt ðɛr ɑr ɔlˈtɜrnətɪvz tə ˈbɪldɪŋ ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ frəm skræʧ | ˈsʌmtaɪmz ɪts ˈbɛtɚ tə bi ˈeɪbəl tə dɪˈlɪvɚ fæst ˈjuzɪŋ ɪɡˈzɪstɪŋ ˈsɜrvɪsɪz
stress: GOOD CALL | It's IMPORTANT to REMEMBER that there are ALTERNATIVES to BUILDING EVERYTHING from SCRATCH | SOMETIMES it's BETTER to BE ABLE to DELIVER FAST using EXISTING SERVICES
linking:
"to be able to" → /tə bi ˈeɪbəl tə/ (smooth link)
"using existing" → /ˈjuzɪŋ ɪɡˈzɪstɪŋ/ (z links to e)

speaker: Emma
text: Agreed! So, we may need to propose both options to the client and let them choose depending on the budget.
ipa: əˈɡrid | soʊ | wi meɪ nid tə prəˈpoʊz boʊθ ˈɑpʃənz tə ðə ˈklaɪənt ənd lɛt ðɛm ʧuz dɪˈpɛndɪŋ ɑn ðə ˈbʌʤɪt
stress: AGREED | So, we MAY NEED to PROPOSE BOTH OPTIONS to the CLIENT and LET them CHOOSE depending on the BUDGET
linking:
"need to" → /nid tə/ (d links to t)
"let them" → /lɛt ðɛm/ (t links to th)

speaker: Noah
text: Exactly. I'll see if I can draw up a quick comparison sheet before the meeting.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | aɪl si ɪf aɪ kən drɔ ʌp ə kwɪk kəmˈpɛrəsən ʃit bɪˈfɔr ðə ˈmitɪŋ
stress: EXACTLY | I'll SEE if I CAN DRAW UP a QUICK COMPARISON SHEET before the MEETING
linking:
"I'll see" → /aɪl si/ (l links to s)
"draw up" → /drɔ ʌp/ (w links to u)
"sheet before" → /ʃit bɪˈfɔr/ (t links to b)
